block.p: Cuban Rallies to Continue Elian Gonzalez is back, but Cuba's government plans to keep up public rallies in hope of rekindling a fading revolutionary ardor. PAGE A9
Cuban Rallies to Continue Elian Gonzalez is back, but Cuba's government plans to keep up public rallies in hope of rekindling a fading revolutionary ardor. PAGE A9
H.M.O.'s Cut Off Medicare Health maintenance organizations will cancel insurance coverage for more than 700,000 Medicare beneficiaries next year. PAGE A23
Life, Liberty and $7 Million A copy of the Declaration of Independence, discovered behind a $4 flea-market painting in 1989, was sold for $7.4 million. PAGE B1
Yankees Trade for Justice Ending their pursuit of the Cubs' Sammy Sosa, the Yankees sent Ricky Ledee to the Indians for David Justice. SPORTSFRIDAY, PAGE D1
